lest_FUNCTION( lest::env & ); \ 131 namespace { lest::add_test lest_REGISTRAR( specification, lest::test( proposition, lest_FUNCTION ) ); } \ 132 static void lest_FUNCTION( lest::env & lest_env ) 133 140 namespace { lest::add_module _( specification, module ); } 141 142 #endif //lest_FEATURE_AUTO_REGISTER 143 144 // Implementation note: made lest__ctx_... a reference to correct lifetime for VC12 (VS2013): 145 146 #define lest_SETUP( context ) \ 147 for ( int lest__section = 0, lest__count = 1; lest__section < lest__count; lest__count -= 0==lest__section++ ) \ 148 if ( lest::ctx const & lest__ctx_setup = lest::ctx( lest_env, context ) ) 149 150 #define lest_SECTION( proposition ) \ 151 static int lest_UNIQUE( id ) = 0; \ 152 if ( lest::guard( lest_UNIQUE( id ), lest__section, lest__count ) ) \ 153 for ( int lest__section = 0, lest__count = 1; lest__section < lest__count; lest__count -= 0==lest__section++ ) \ 154 if ( lest::ctx const & lest__ctx_section = lest::ctx( lest_env, proposition ) ) 155 156 #define lest_EXPECT( expr ) \ 157 do { \ 158 try \ 159 { \ 160 if ( lest::result score = lest_DECOMPOSE( expr ) ) \ 161 throw lest::failure{ lest_LOCATION, #expr, score.decomposition }; \ 162 else if ( lest_env.pass() ) \ 163 lest::report( lest_env.os, lest::passing{ lest_LOCATION, #expr, score.decomposition }, lest_env.context() ); \ 164 } \ 165 catch(...) \ 166 { \ 167 lest::inform( lest_LOCATION, #expr ); \ 168 } \ 169 } while ( lest::is_false() ) 170 171 #define lest_EXPECT_NOT( expr ) \ 172 do { \ 173 try \ 174 { \ 175 if ( lest::result score = lest_DECOMPOSE( expr ) ) \ 176 { \ 177 if ( lest_env.pass() ) \ 178 lest::report( lest_env.os, lest::passing{ lest_LOCATION, lest::not_expr( #expr ), lest::not_expr( score.decomposition ) }, lest_env.context() ); \ 179 } \ 180 else \ 181 throw lest::failure{ lest_LOCATION, lest::not_expr( #expr ), lest::not_expr( score.decomposition ) }; \ 182 } \ 183 catch(...) \ 184 { \ 185 lest::inform( lest_LOCATION, lest::not_expr( #expr ) ); \ 186 } \ 187 } while ( lest::is_false() ) 188 189 #define lest_EXPECT_NO_THROW( expr ) \ 190 do \ 191 { \ 192 try \ 193 { \ 194 expr; \ 195 } \ 196 catch (...) \ 197 { \ 198 lest::inform( lest_LOCATION, #expr ); \ 199 } \ 200 if ( lest_env.pass() ) \ 201 lest::report( lest_env.os, lest::got_none( lest_LOCATION, #expr ), lest_env.context() ); \ 202 } while ( lest::is_false() ) 203 204 #define lest_EXPECT_THROWS( expr ) \ 205 do \ 206 { \ 207 try \ 208 { \ 209 expr; \ 210 } \ 211 catch (...) \ 212 { \ 213 if ( lest_env.pass() ) \ 214 lest::report( lest_env.os, lest::got{ lest_LOCATION, #expr }, lest_env.context() ); \ 215 break; \ 216 } \ 217 throw lest::expected{ lest_LOCATION, #expr }; \ 218 } \ 219 while ( lest::is_false() ) 220 221 #define lest_EXPECT_THROWS_AS( expr, excpt ) \ 222 do \ 223 { \ 224 try \ 225 { \ 226 expr; \ 227 } \ 228 catch ( excpt & ) \ 229 { \ 230 if ( lest_env.pass() ) \ 231 lest::report( lest_env.os, lest::got{ lest_LOCATION, #expr, lest::of_type( #excpt ) }, lest_env.context() ); \ 232 break; \ 233 } \ 234 catch (...) {} \ 235 throw lest::expected{ lest_LOCATION, #expr, lest::of_type( #excpt ) }; \ 236 } \ 237 while ( lest::is_false() ) 238 239 #define lest_UNIQUE( name ) lest_UNIQUE2( name, __LINE__ ) 240 #define lest_UNIQUE2( name, line ) lest_UNIQUE3( name, line ) 241 #define lest_UNIQUE3( name, line ) name ## line 242 243 #define lest_DECOMPOSE( expr ) ( lest::expression_decomposer() << expr ) 244 245 #define lest_FUNCTION lest_UNIQUE(__lest_function__ ) 246 #define lest_REGISTRAR lest_UNIQUE(__lest_registrar__ ) 247 248 #define lest_LOCATION lest::location{__FILE__, __LINE__} 249 250 namespace lest { 251 252 const int exit_max_value = 255; 253 254 using text = std::string; 255 using texts = std::vector<text>; 256 257 struct env; 258 259 struct test 260 { 261 text name; 262 std::function<void( env & )> behaviour; 263 264 #if lest_FEATURE_AUTO_REGISTER 265 test( text name, std::function<void( env & )> behaviour ) 266 : name( name ), behaviour( behaviour ) {} 267 #endif 268 }; 269 270 using tests = std::vector<test>; 271 272 #if lest_FEATURE_AUTO_REGISTER 273 274 struct add_test 275 { 276 add_test( tests & specification, test const & test_case ) 277 { 278 specification.push_back( test_case ); 279 } 280 }; 281 282 #else 283 284 struct add_module 285 { 286 template< std::size_t N > 287 add_module( tests & specification, test const (&module)[N] ) 288 { 289 specification.insert( specification.end(), std::begin( module ), std::end( module ) ); 290 } 291 }; 292 293 #endif 294 295 struct result 296 { 297 const bool passed; 298 const text decomposition; 299 300 template< typename T > 301 result( T const & passed_, text decomposition_) 302 : passed( !!passed_), decomposition( decomposition_) {} 303 304 explicit operator bool() { return ! passed; } 305 }; 306 307 struct location 308 { 309 const text file; 310 const int line; 311 312 location( text file_, int line_) 313 : file( file_), line( line_) {} 314 }; 315 316 struct comment 317 { 318 const text info; 319 320 comment( text info_) : info( info_) {} 321 explicit operator bool() { return ! info.empty(); } 322 }; 323 324 struct message : std::runtime_error 325 { 326 const text kind; 327 const location where; 328 const comment note; 329 330 ~message() throw() {} // GCC 4.6 331 332 message( text kind_, location where_, text expr_, text note_ = "" ) 333 : std::runtime_error( expr_), kind( kind_), where( where_), note( note_) {} 334 }; 335 336 struct failure : message 337 { 338 failure( location where_, text expr_, text decomposition_) 339 : message{ "failed", where_, expr_ + " for " + decomposition_ } {} 340 }; 341 342 struct success : message 343 { 344 // using message::message; // VC is lagging here 345 346 success( text kind_, location where_, text expr_, text note_ = "" ) 347 : message( kind_, where_, expr_, note_ ) {} 348 }; 349 350 struct passing : success 351 { 352 passing( location where_, text expr_, text decomposition_ ) 353 : success( "passed", where_, expr_ + " for " + decomposition_) {} 354 }; 355 356 struct got_none : success 357 { 358 got_none( location where_, text expr_ ) 359 : success( "passed: got no exception", where_, expr_ ) {} 360 }; 361 362 struct got : success 363 { 364 got( location where_, text expr_) 365 : success( "passed: got exception", where_, expr_) {} 366 367 got( location where_, text expr_, text excpt_) 368 : success( "passed: got exception " + excpt_, where_, expr_) {} 369 }; 370 371 struct expected : message 372 { 373 expected( location where_, text expr_, text excpt_ = "" ) 374 : message{ "failed: didn't get exception", where_, expr_, excpt_ } {} 375 }; 376 377 struct unexpected : message 378 { 379 unexpected( location where_, text expr_, text note_ = "" ) 380 : message{ "failed: got unexpected exception", where_, expr_, note_ } {} 381 }; 382 383 struct guard 384 { 385 int & id; 386 int const & section; 387 388 guard( int & id_, int const & section_, int & count ) 389 : id( id_), section( section_) 390 { 391 if ( section == 0 ) 392 id = count++ - 1; 393 } 394 operator bool() { return id == section; } 395 }; 396 397 class approx 398 { 399 public: 400 explicit approx ( double magnitude ) 401 : epsilon_ { std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon() * 100 } 402 , scale_ { 1.0 } 403 , magnitude_{ magnitude } {} 404 405 approx( approx const & other ) = default; 406 407 static approx custom() { return approx( 0 ); } 408 409 approx operator()( double new_magnitude ) 410 { 411 approx appr( new_magnitude ); 412 appr.epsilon( epsilon_ ); 413 appr.scale ( scale_ ); 414 return appr; 415 } 416 417 double magnitude() const { return magnitude_; } 418 419 approx & epsilon( double epsilon ) { epsilon_ = epsilon; return *this; } 420 approx & scale ( double scale ) { scale_ = scale; return *this; } 421 422 friend bool operator == ( double lhs, approx const & rhs ) 423 { 424 // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining this formula. 425 return std::abs( lhs - rhs.magnitude_ ) < rhs.epsilon_ * ( rhs.scale_ + (std::min)( std::abs( lhs ), std::abs( rhs.magnitude_ ) ) ); 426 } 427 428 friend bool operator == ( approx const & lhs, double rhs ) { return operator==( rhs, lhs ); } 429 friend bool operator != ( double lhs, approx const & rhs ) { return !operator==( lhs, rhs ); } 430 friend bool operator != ( approx const & lhs, double rhs ) { return !operator==( rhs, lhs ); } 431 432 friend bool operator <= ( double lhs, approx const & rhs ) { return lhs < rhs.magnitude_ || lhs == rhs; } 433 friend bool operator <= ( approx const & lhs, double rhs ) { return lhs.magnitude_ < rhs || lhs == rhs; } 434 friend bool operator >= ( double lhs, approx const & rhs ) { return lhs > rhs.magnitude_ || lhs == rhs; } 435 friend bool operator >= ( approx const & lhs, double rhs ) { return lhs.magnitude_ > rhs || lhs == rhs; } 436 437 private: 438 double epsilon_; 439 double scale_; 440 double magnitude_; 441 }; 442 443 inline bool is_false( ) { return false; } 444 inline bool is_true ( bool flag ) { return flag; } 445 446 inline text not_expr( text message ) 447 { 448 return "! ( " + message + " )"; 449 } 450 451 inline text with_message( text message ) 452 { 453 return "with message \"" + message + "\""; 454 } 455 456 inline text of_type( text type ) 457 { 458 return "of type " + type; 459 } 460 461 inline void inform( location where, text expr ) 462 { 463 try 464 { 465 throw; 466 } 467 catch( message const & ) 468 { 469 throw; 470 } 471 catch( std::exception const & e ) 472 { 473 throw unexpected{ where, expr, with_message( e.what() ) }; \ 474 } 475 catch(...) 476 { 477 throw unexpected{ where, expr, "of unknown type" }; \ 478 } 479 } 480 481 // Expression decomposition: 482 483 template< typename T > 484 auto make_value_string( T const & value ) -> std::string; 485 486 template< typename T > 487 auto make_memory_string( T const & item ) -> std::string; 488 489 #if lest_FEATURE_LITERAL_SUFFIX 490 inline char const * sfx( char const * txt ) { return txt; } 491 #else 492 inline char const * sfx( char const * ) { return ""; } 493 #endif 494 495 inline std::string to_string( std::nullptr_t ) { return "nullptr"; } 496 inline std::string to_string( std::string const & txt ) { return "\"" + txt + "\"" ; } 497 #if lest_FEATURE_WSTRING 498 inline std::string to_string( std::wstring const & txt ) ; 499 #endif 500 501 inline std::string to_string( char const * const txt ) { return txt ? to_string( std::string ( txt ) ) : "{null string}"; } 502 inline std::string to_string( char * const txt ) { return txt ? to_string( std::string ( txt ) ) : "{null string}"; } 503 #if lest_FEATURE_WSTRING 504 inline std::string to_string( wchar_t const * const txt ) { return txt ? to_string( std::wstring( txt ) ) : "{null string}"; } 505 inline std::string to_string( wchar_t * const txt ) { return txt ? to_string( std::wstring( txt ) ) : "{null string}"; } 506 #endif 507 508 inline std::string to_string( bool flag ) { return flag ? "true" : "false"; } 509 510 inline std::string to_string( signed short value ) { return make_value_string( value ) ; } 511 inline std::string to_string( unsigned short value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("u" ); } 512 inline std::string to_string( signed int value ) { return make_value_string( value ) ; } 513 inline std::string to_string( unsigned int value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("u" ); } 514 inline std::string to_string( signed long value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("l" ); } 515 inline std::string to_string( unsigned long value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("ul" ); } 516 inline std::string to_string( signed long long value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("ll" ); } 517 inline std::string to_string( unsigned long long value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("ull"); } 518 inline std::string to_string( double value ) { return make_value_string( value ) ; } 519 inline std::string to_string( float value ) { return make_value_string( value ) + sfx("f" ); } 520 521 inline std::string to_string( signed char chr ) { return to_string( static_cast<char>( chr ) ); } 522 inline std::string to_string( unsigned char chr ) { return to_string( static_cast<char>( chr ) ); } 523 524 inline std::string to_string( char chr ) 525 { 526 struct Tr { char chr; char const * str; } table[] = 527 { 528 {'\r', "'\\r'" }, {'\f', "'\\f'" }, 529 {'\n', "'\\n'" }, {'\t', "'\\t'" }, 530 }; 531 532 for ( auto tr : table ) 533 { 534 if ( chr == tr.chr ) 535 return tr.str; 536 } 537 538 auto unprintable = [](char c){ return 0 <= c && c < ' '; }; 539 540 return unprintable( chr ) 541 ? to_string( static_cast<unsigned int>( chr ) ) 542 : "\'" + std::string( 1, chr ) + "\'" ; 543 } 544 545 template< typename T > 546 struct is_streamable 547 { 548 template< typename U > 549 static auto test( int ) -> decltype( std::declval<std::ostream &>() << std::declval<U>(), std::true_type() ); 550 551 template< typename > 552 static auto test( ... ) -> std::false_type; 553 554 #ifdef _MSC_VER 555 enum { value = std::is_same< decltype( test<T>(0) ), std::true_type >::value }; 556 #else 557 static constexpr bool value = std::is_same< decltype( test<T>(0) ), std::true_type >::value; 558 #endif 559 }; 560 561 template< typename T > 562 struct is_container 563 { 564 template< typename U > 565 static auto test( int ) -> decltype( std::declval<U>().begin() == std::declval<U>().end(), std::true_type() ); 566 567 template< typename > 568 static auto test( ... ) -> std::false_type; 569 570 #ifdef _MSC_VER 571 enum { value = std::is_same< decltype( test<T>(0) ), std::true_type >::value }; 572 #else 573 static constexpr bool value = std::is_same< decltype( test<T>(0) ), std::true_type >::value; 574 #endif 575 }; 576 577 template< typename T, typename R > 578 using ForEnum = typename std::enable_if< std::is_enum<T>::value, R>::type; 579 580 template< typename T, typename R > 581 using ForNonEnum = typename std::enable_if< ! std::is_enum<T>::value, R>::type; 582 583 template< typename T, typename R > 584 using ForStreamable = typename std::enable_if< is_streamable<T>::value, R>::type; 585 586 template< typename T, typename R > 587 using ForNonStreamable = typename std::enable_if< ! is_streamable<T>::value, R>::type; 588 589 template< typename T, typename R > 590 using ForContainer = typename std::enable_if< is_container<T>::value, R>::type; 591 592 template< typename T, typename R > 593 using ForNonContainer = typename std::enable_if< ! is_container<T>::value, R>::type; 594 595 template< typename T > 596 auto make_enum_string( T const & ) -> ForNonEnum<T, std::string> 597 { 598 #if lest__cpp_rtti 599 return text("[type: ") + typeid(T).name() + "]"; 600 #else 601 return text("[type: (no RTTI)]"); 602 #endif 603 } 604 605 template< typename T > 606 auto make_enum_string( T const & item ) -> ForEnum<T, std::string> 607 { 608 return to_string( static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>( item ) ); 609 } 610 611 template< typename T > 612 auto make_string( T const & item ) -> ForNonStreamable<T, std::string> 613 { 614 return make_enum_string( item ); 615 } 616 617 template< typename T > 618 auto make_string( T const & item ) -> ForStreamable<T, std::string> 619 { 620 std::ostringstream os; os << item; return os.str(); 621 } 622 623 template< typename T > 624 auto make_string( T * p )-> std::string 625 { 626 if ( p ) return make_memory_string( p ); 627 else return "NULL"; 628 } 629 630 template<typename C, typename R> 631 auto make_string( R C::* p ) -> std::string 632 { 633 if ( p ) return make_memory_string( p ); 634 else return "NULL"; 635 } 636 637 template<typename T1, typename T2> 638 auto make_string( std::pair<T1,T2> const & pair ) -> std::string 639 { 640 std::ostringstream oss; 641 oss << "{ " << to_string( pair.first ) << ", " << to_string( pair.second ) << " }"; 642 return oss.str(); 643 } 644 645 template< typename TU, std::size_t N > 646 struct make_tuple_string 647 { 648 static std::string make( TU const & tuple ) 649 { 650 std::ostringstream os; 651 os << to_string( std::get<N - 1>( tuple ) ) << ( N < std::tuple_size<TU>::value ? ", ": " "); 652 return make_tuple_string<TU, N - 1>::make( tuple ) + os.str(); 653 } 654 }; 655 656 template< typename TU > 657 struct make_tuple_string<TU, 0> 658 { 659 static std::string make( TU const & ) { return ""; } 660 }; 661 662 template< typename ...TS > 663 auto make_string( std::tuple<TS...> const & tuple ) -> std::string 664 { 665 return "{ " + make_tuple_string<std::tuple<TS...>, sizeof...(TS)>::make( tuple ) + "}"; 666 } 667 668 template< typename T > 669 auto to_string( T const & item ) -> ForNonContainer<T, std::string> 670 { 671 return make_string( item ); 672 } 673 674 template< typename C > 675 auto to_string( C const & cont ) -> ForContainer<C, std::string> 676 { 677 std::ostringstream os; 678 os << "{ "; 679 for ( auto & x : cont ) 680 { 681 os << to_string( x ) << ", "; 682 } 683 os << "}"; 684 return os.str(); 685 } 686 687 #if lest_FEATURE_WSTRING 688 inline 689 auto to_string( std::wstring const & txt ) -> std::string 690 { 691 std::string result; result.reserve( txt.size() ); 692 693 for( auto & chr : txt ) 694 { 695 result += chr <= 0xff ? static_cast<char>( chr ) : '?'; 696 } 697 return to_string( result ); 698 } 699 #endif 700 701 template< typename T > 702 auto make_value_string( T const & value ) -> std::string 703 { 704 std::ostringstream os; os << value; return os.str(); 705 } 706 707 inline 708 auto make_memory_string( void const * item, std::size_t size ) -> std::string 709 { 710 // reverse order for little endian architectures: 711 712 auto is_little_endian = [] 713 { 714 union U { int i = 1; char c[ sizeof(int) ]; }; 715 716 return 1 != U{}.c[ sizeof(int) - 1 ]; 717 }; 718 719 int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1; 720 721 if ( is_little_endian() ) { i = end - 1; end = inc = -1; } 722 723 unsigned char const * bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>( item ); 724 725 std::ostringstream os; 726 os << "0x" << std::setfill( '0' ) << std::hex; 727 for ( ; i != end; i += inc ) 728 { 729 os << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>( bytes[i] ) << " "; 730 } 731 return os.str(); 732 } 733 734 template< typename T > 735 auto make_memory_string( T const & item ) -> std::string 736 { 737 return make_memory_string( &item, sizeof item ); 738 } 739 740 inline 741 auto to_string( approx const & appr ) -> std::string 742 { 743 return to_string( appr.magnitude() ); 744 } 745 746 template< typename L, typename R > 747 auto to_string( L const & lhs, std::string op, R const & rhs ) -> std::string 748 { 749 std::ostringstream os; os << to_string( lhs ) << " " << op << " " << to_string( rhs ); return os.str(); 750 } 751 752 template< typename L > 753 struct expression_lhs 754 { 755 const L lhs; 756 757 expression_lhs( L lhs_) : lhs( lhs_) {} 758 759 operator result() { return result{ !!lhs, to_string( lhs ) }; } 760 761 template< typename R > result operator==( R const & rhs ) { return result{ lhs == rhs, to_string( lhs, "==", rhs ) }; } 762 template< typename R > result operator!=( R const & rhs ) { return result{ lhs != rhs, to_string( lhs, "!=", rhs ) }; } 763 template< typename R > result operator< ( R const & rhs ) { return result{ lhs < rhs, to_string( lhs, "<" , rhs ) }; } 764 template< typename R > result operator<=( R const & rhs ) { return result{ lhs <= rhs, to_string( lhs, "<=", rhs ) }; } 765 template< typename R > result operator> ( R const & rhs ) { return result{ lhs > rhs, to_string( lhs, ">" , rhs ) }; } 766 template< typename R > result operator>=( R const & rhs ) { return result{ lhs >= rhs, to_string( lhs, ">=", rhs ) }; } 767 }; 768 769 struct expression_decomposer 770 { 771 template <typename L> 772 expression_lhs<L const &> operator<< ( L const & operand ) 773 { 774 return expression_lhs<L const &>( operand ); 775 } 776 }; 777 778 // Reporter: 779 780 #if lest_FEATURE_COLOURISE 781 782 inline text red ( text words ) { return "\033[1;31m" + words + "\033[0m"; } 783 inline text green( text words ) { return "\033[1;32m" + words + "\033[0m"; } 784 inline text gray ( text words ) { return "\033[1;30m" + words + "\033[0m"; } 785 786 inline bool starts_with( text words, text with ) 787 { 788 return 0 == words.find( with ); 789 } 790 791 inline text replace( text words, text from, text to ) 792 { 793 size_t pos = words.find( from ); 794 return pos == std::string::npos ? words : words.replace( pos, from.length(), to ); 795 } 796 797 inline text colour( text words ) 798 { 799 if ( starts_with( words, "failed" ) ) return replace( words, "failed", red ( "failed" ) ); 800 else if ( starts_with( words, "passed" ) ) return replace( words, "passed", green( "passed" ) ); 801 802 return replace( words, "for", gray( "for" ) ); 803 } 804 805 inline bool is_cout( std::ostream & os ) { return &os == &std::cout; } 806 807 struct colourise 808 { 809 const text words; 810 811 colourise( text words ) 812 : words( words ) {} 813 814 // only colourise for std::cout, not for a stringstream as used in tests: 815 816 std::ostream & operator()( std::ostream & os ) const 817 { 818 return is_cout( os ) ? os << colour( words ) : os << words; 819 } 820 }; 821 822 inline std::ostream & operator<<( std::ostream & os, colourise words ) { return words( os ); } 823 #else 824 inline text colourise( text words ) { return words; } 825 #endif 826 827 inline text pluralise( text word, int n ) 828 { 829 return n == 1 ? word : word + "s"; 830 } 831 832 inline std::ostream & operator<<( std::ostream & os, comment note ) 833 { 834 return os << (note ? " " + note.info : "" ); 835 } 836 837 inline std::ostream & operator<<( std::ostream & os, location where ) 838 { 839 #ifdef __GNUG__ 840 return os << where.file << ":" << where.line; 841 #else 842 return os << where.file << "(" << where.line << ")"; 843 #endif 844 } 845 846 inline void report( std::ostream & os, message const & e, text test ) 847 { 848 os << e.where << ": " << colourise( e.kind ) << e.note << ": " << test << ": " << colourise( e.what() ) << std::endl; 849 } 850 851 // Test runner: 852 853 #if lest_FEATURE_REGEX_SEARCH 854 inline bool search( text re, text line ) 855 { 856 return std::regex_search( line, std::regex( re ) ); 857 } 858 #else 859 inline bool search( text part, text line ) 860 { 861 auto case_insensitive_equal = []( char a, char b ) 862 { 863 return tolower( a ) == tolower( b ); 864 }; 865 866 return std::search( 867 line.begin(), line.end(), 868 part.begin(), part.end(), case_insensitive_equal ) != line.end(); 869 } 870 #endif 871 872 inline bool match( texts whats, text line ) 873 { 874 for ( auto & what : whats ) 875 { 876 if ( search( what, line ) ) 877 return true; 878 } 879 return false; 880 } 881 882 inline bool select( text name, texts include ) 883 { 884 auto none = []( texts args ) { return args.size() == 0; }; 885 886 #if lest_FEATURE_REGEX_SEARCH 887 auto hidden = []( text arg ){ return match( { "\\[\\..*", "\\[hide\\]" }, arg ); }; 888 #else 889 auto hidden = []( text arg ){ return match( { "[.", "[hide]" }, arg ); }; 890 #endif 891 892 if ( none( include ) ) 893 { 894 return ! hidden( name ); 895 } 896 897 bool any = false; 898 for ( auto pos = include.rbegin(); pos != include.rend(); ++pos ) 899 { 900 auto & part = *pos; 901 902 if ( part == "@" || part == "*" ) 903 return true; 904 905 if ( search( part, name ) ) 906 return true; 907 908 if ( '!' == part[0] ) 909 { 910 any = true; 911 if ( search( part.substr(1), name ) ) 912 return false; 913 } 914 else 915 { 916 any = false; 917 } 918 } 919 return any && ! hidden( name ); 920 } 921 922 inline int indefinite( int repeat ) { return repeat == -1; } 923 924 using seed_t = unsigned long; 925 926 struct options 927 { 928 bool help = false; 929 bool abort = false; 930 bool count = false; 931 bool list = false; 932 bool tags = false; 933 bool time = false; 934 bool pass = false; 935 bool lexical = false; 936 bool random = false; 937 bool verbose = false; 938 bool version = false; 939 int repeat = 1; 940 seed_t seed = 0; 941 }; 942 943 struct env 944 { 945 std::ostream & os; 946 options opt; 947 text testing; 948 std::vector< text > ctx; 949 950 env( std::ostream & out, options option ) 951 : os( out ), opt( option ), testing(), ctx() {} 952 953 env & operator()( text test ) 954 { 955 testing = test; return *this; 956 } 957 958 bool abort() { return opt.abort; } 959 bool pass() { return opt.pass; } 960 961 void pop() { ctx.pop_back(); } 962 void push( text proposition ) { ctx.emplace_back( proposition ); } 963 964 text context() { return testing + sections(); } 965 966 text sections() 967 { 968 if ( ! opt.verbose ) 969 return ""; 970 971 text msg; 972 for( auto section : ctx ) 973 { 974 msg += "\n " + section; 975 } 976 return msg; 977 } 978 }; 979 980 struct ctx 981 { 982 env & environment; 983 984 ctx( env & environment_, text proposition ) 985 : environment{ environment_ } 986 { 987 environment.push( proposition ); 988 } 989 990 ~ctx() 991 { 992 #if lest_CPP17_OR_GREATER 993 if ( std::uncaught_exceptions() == 0 ) 994 #else 995 if ( ! std::uncaught_exception() ) 996 #endif 997 { 998 environment.pop(); 999 } 1000 } 1001 1002 explicit operator bool() const { return true; } 1003 }; 1004 1005 struct action 1006 { 1007 std::ostream & os; 1008 1009 action( std::ostream & out ) : os( out ) {} 1010 1011 action( action const & ) = delete; 1012 void operator=( action const & ) = delete; 1013 1014 operator int() { return 0; } 1015 bool abort() { return false; } 1016 action & operator()( test ) { return *this; } 1017 }; 1018 1019 struct print : action 1020 { 1021 print( std::ostream & out ) : action( out ) {} 1022 1023 print & operator()( test testing ) 1024 { 1025 os << testing.name << "\n"; return *this; 1026 } 1027 }; 1028 1029 inline texts tags( text name, texts result = {} ) 1030 { 1031 auto none = std::string::npos; 1032 auto lb = name.find_first_of( "[" ); 1033 auto rb = name.find_first_of( "]" ); 1034 1035 if ( lb == none || rb == none ) 1036 return result; 1037 1038 result.emplace_back( name.substr( lb, rb - lb + 1 ) ); 1039 1040 return tags( name.substr( rb + 1 ), result ); 1041 } 1042 1043 struct ptags : action 1044 { 1045 std::set<text> result; 1046 1047 ptags( std::ostream & out ) : action( out ), result() {} 1048 1049 ptags & operator()( test testing ) 1050 { 1051 for ( auto & tag : tags( testing.name ) ) 1052 result.insert( tag ); 1053 1054 return *this; 1055 } 1056 1057 ~ptags() 1058 { 1059 std::copy( result.begin(), result.end(), std::ostream_iterator<text>( os, "\n" ) ); 1060 } 1061 }; 1062 1063 struct count : action 1064 { 1065 int n = 0; 1066 1067 count( std::ostream & out ) : action( out ) {} 1068 1069 count & operator()( test ) { ++n; return *this; } 1070 1071 ~count() 1072 { 1073 os << n << " selected " << pluralise("test", n) << "\n"; 1074 } 1075 }; 1076 1077 struct timer 1078 { 1079 using time = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock; 1080 1081 time::time_point start = time::now(); 1082 1083 double elapsed_seconds() const 1084 { 1085 return 1e-6 * static_cast<double>( std::chrono::duration_cast< std::chrono::microseconds >( time::now() - start ).count() ); 1086 } 1087 }; 1088 1089 struct times : action 1090 { 1091 env output; 1092 int selected = 0; 1093 int failures = 0; 1094 1095 timer total; 1096 1097 times( std::ostream & out, options option ) 1098 : action( out ), output( out, option ), total() 1099 { 1100 os << std::setfill(' ') << std::fixed << std::setprecision( lest_FEATURE_TIME_PRECISION ); 1101 } 1102 1103 operator int() { return failures; } 1104 1105 bool abort() { return output.abort() && failures > 0; } 1106 1107 times & operator()( test testing ) 1108 { 1109 timer t; 1110 1111 try 1112 { 1113 testing.behaviour( output( testing.name ) ); 1114 } 1115 catch( message const & ) 1116 { 1117 ++failures; 1118 } 1119 1120 os << std::setw(3) << ( 1000 * t.elapsed_seconds() ) << " ms: " << testing.name << "\n"; 1121 1122 return *this; 1123 } 1124 1125 ~times() 1126 { 1127 os << "Elapsed time: " << std::setprecision(1) << total.elapsed_seconds() << " s\n"; 1128 } 1129 }; 1130 1131 struct confirm : action 1132 { 1133 env output; 1134 int selected = 0; 1135 int failures = 0; 1136 1137 confirm( std::ostream & out, options option ) 1138 : action( out ), output( out, option ) {} 1139 1140 operator int() { return failures; } 1141 1142 bool abort() { return output.abort() && failures > 0; } 1143 1144 confirm & operator()( test testing ) 1145 { 1146 try 1147 { 1148 ++selected; testing.behaviour( output( testing.name ) ); 1149 } 1150 catch( message const & e ) 1151 { 1152 ++failures; report( os, e, output.context() ); 1153 } 1154 return *this; 1155 } 1156 1157 ~confirm() 1158 { 1159 if ( failures > 0 ) 1160 { 1161 os << failures << " out of " << selected << " selected " << pluralise("test", selected) << " " << colourise( "failed.\n" ); 1162 } 1163 else if ( output.pass() ) 1164 { 1165 os << "All " << selected << " selected " << pluralise("test", selected) << " " << colourise( "passed.\n" ); 1166 } 1167 } 1168 }; 1169 1170 template< typename Action > 1171 bool abort( Action & perform ) 1172 { 1173 return perform.abort(); 1174 } 1175 1176 template< typename Action > 1177 Action && for_test( tests specification, texts in, Action && perform, int n = 1 ) 1178 { 1179 for ( int i = 0; indefinite( n ) || i < n; ++i ) 1180 { 1181 for ( auto & testing : specification ) 1182 { 1183 if ( select( testing.name, in ) ) 1184 if ( abort( perform( testing ) ) ) 1185 return std::move( perform ); 1186 } 1187 } 1188 return std::move( perform ); 1189 } 1190 1191 inline void sort( tests & specification ) 1192 { 1193 auto test_less = []( test const & a, test const & b ) { return a.name < b.name; }; 1194 std::sort( specification.begin(), specification.end(), test_less ); 1195 } 1196 1197 inline void shuffle( tests & specification, options option ) 1198 { 1199 std::shuffle( specification.begin(), specification.end(), std::mt19937( option.seed ) ); 1200 } 1201 1202 // workaround MinGW bug, http://stackoverflow.com/a/16132279: 1203 1204 inline int stoi( text num ) 1205 { 1206 return static_cast<int>( std::strtol( num.c_str(), nullptr, 10 ) ); 1207 } 1208 1209 inline bool is_number( text arg ) 1210 { 1211 return std::all_of( arg.begin(), arg.end(), ::isdigit ); 1212 } 1213 1214 inline seed_t seed( text opt, text arg ) 1215 { 1216 if ( is_number( arg ) ) 1217 return static_cast<seed_t>( lest::stoi( arg ) ); 1218 1219 if ( arg == "time" ) 1220 return static_cast<seed_t>( std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch().count() ); 1221 1222 throw std::runtime_error( "expecting 'time' or positive number with option '" + opt + "', got '" + arg + "' (try option --help)" ); 1223 } 1224 1225 inline int repeat( text opt, text arg ) 1226 { 1227 const int num = lest::stoi( arg ); 1228 1229 if ( indefinite( num ) || num >= 0 ) 1230 return num; 1231 1232 throw std::runtime_error( "expecting '-1' or positive number with option '" + opt + "', got '" + arg + "' (try option --help)" ); 1233 } 1234 1235 inline auto split_option( text arg ) -> std::tuple<text, text> 1236 { 1237 auto pos = arg.rfind( '=' ); 1238 1239 return pos == text::npos 1240 ? std::make_tuple( arg, "" ) 1241 : std::make_tuple( arg.substr( 0, pos ), arg.substr( pos + 1 ) ); 1242 } 1243 1244 inline auto split_arguments( texts args ) -> std::tuple<options, texts> 1245 { 1246 options option; texts in; 1247 1248 bool in_options = true; 1249 1250 for ( auto & arg : args ) 1251 { 1252 if ( in_options ) 1253 { 1254 text opt, val; 1255 std::tie( opt, val ) = split_option( arg ); 1256 1257 if ( opt[0] != '-' ) { in_options = false; } 1258 else if ( opt == "--" ) { in_options = false; continue; } 1259 else if ( opt == "-h" || "--help" == opt ) { option.help = true; continue; } 1260 else if ( opt == "-a" || "--abort" == opt ) { option.abort = true; continue; } 1261 else if ( opt == "-c" || "--count" == opt ) { option.count = true; continue; } 1262 else if ( opt == "-g" || "--list-tags" == opt ) { option.tags = true; continue; } 1263 else if ( opt == "-l" || "--list-tests" == opt ) { option.list = true; continue; } 1264 else if ( opt == "-t" || "--time" == opt ) { option.time = true; continue; } 1265 else if ( opt == "-p" || "--pass" == opt ) { option.pass = true; continue; } 1266 else if ( opt == "-v" || "--verbose" == opt ) { option.verbose = true; continue; } 1267 else if ( "--version" == opt ) { option.version = true; continue; } 1268 else if ( opt == "--order" && "declared" == val ) { /* by definition */ ; continue; } 1269 else if ( opt == "--order" && "lexical" == val ) { option.lexical = true; continue; } 1270 else if ( opt == "--order" && "random" == val ) { option.random = true; continue; } 1271 else if ( opt == "--random-seed" ) { option.seed = seed ( "--random-seed", val ); continue; } 1272 else if ( opt == "--repeat" ) { option.repeat = repeat( "--repeat" , val ); continue; } 1273 else throw std::runtime_error( "unrecognised option '" + arg + "' (try option --help)" ); 1274 } 1275 in.push_back( arg ); 1276 } 1277 return std::make_tuple( option, in ); 1278 } 1279 1280 inline int usage( std::ostream & os ) 1281 { 1282 os << 1283 "\nUsage: test [options] [test-spec ...]\n" 1284 "\n" 1285 "Options:\n" 1286 " -h, --help this help message\n" 1287 " -a, --abort abort at first failure\n" 1288 " -c, --count count selected tests\n" 1289 " -g, --list-tags list tags of selected tests\n" 1290 " -l, --list-tests list selected tests\n" 1291 " -p, --pass also report passing tests\n" 1292 " -t, --time list duration of selected tests\n" 1293 " -v, --verbose also report passing or failing sections\n" 1294 " --order=declared use source code test order (default)\n" 1295 " --order=lexical use lexical sort test order\n" 1296 " --order=random use random test order\n" 1297 " --random-seed=n use n for random generator seed\n" 1298 " --random-seed=time use time for random generator seed\n" 1299 " --repeat=n repeat selected tests n times (-1: indefinite)\n" 1300 " --version report lest version and compiler used\n" 1301 " -- end options\n" 1302 "\n" 1303 "Test specification:\n" 1304 " \"@\", \"*\" all tests, unless excluded\n" 1305 " empty all tests, unless tagged [hide] or [.optional-name]\n" 1306 #if lest_FEATURE_REGEX_SEARCH 1307 " \"re\" select tests that match regular expression\n" 1308 " \"!re\" omit tests that match regular expression\n" 1309 #else 1310 " \"text\" select tests that contain text (case insensitive)\n" 1311 " \"!text\" omit tests that contain text (case insensitive)\n" 1312 #endif 1313 ; 1314 return 0; 1315 } 1316 1317 inline text compiler() 1318 { 1319 std::ostringstream os; 1320 #if defined (__clang__ ) 1321 os << "clang " << __clang_version__; 1322 #elif defined (__GNUC__ ) 1323 os << "gcc " << __GNUC__ << "." << __GNUC_MINOR__ << "." << __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__; 1324 #elif defined ( _MSC_VER ) 1325 os << "MSVC " << (_MSC_VER / 100 - 5 - (_MSC_VER < 1900)) << " (" << _MSC_VER << ")"; 1326 #else 1327 os << "[compiler]"; 1328 #endif 1329 return os.str(); 1330 } 1331 1332 inline int version( std::ostream & os ) 1333 { 1334 os << "lest version " << lest_VERSION << "\n" 1335 << "Compiled with " << compiler() << " on " << __DATE__ << " at " << __TIME__ << ".\n" 1336 << "For more information, see https://github.com/martinmoene/lest.\n"; 1337 return 0; 1338 } 1339 1340 inline int run( tests specification, texts arguments, std::ostream & os = std::cout ) 1341 { 1342 try 1343 { 1344 options option; texts in; 1345 std::tie( option, in ) = split_arguments( arguments ); 1346 1347 if ( option.lexical ) { sort( specification ); } 1348 if ( option.random ) { shuffle( specification, option ); } 1349 1350 if ( option.help ) { return usage ( os ); } 1351 if ( option.version ) { return version ( os ); } 1352 if ( option.count ) { return for_test( specification, in, count( os ) ); } 1353 if ( option.list ) { return for_test( specification, in, print( os ) ); } 1354 if ( option.tags ) { return for_test( specification, in, ptags( os ) ); } 1355 if ( option.time ) { return for_test( specification, in, times( os, option ) ); } 1356 1357 return for_test( specification, in, confirm( os, option ), option.repeat ); 1358 } 1359 catch ( std::exception const & e ) 1360 { 1361 os << "Error: " << e.what() << "\n"; 1362 return 1; 1363 } 1364 } 1365 1366 inline int run( tests specification, int argc, char * argv[], std::ostream & os = std::cout ) 1367 { 1368 return run( specification, texts( argv + 1, argv + argc ), os ); 1369 } 1370 1371 template< std::size_t N > 1372 int run( test const (&specification)[N], texts arguments, std::ostream & os = std::cout ) 1373 { 1374 std::cout.sync_with_stdio( false ); 1375 return (std::min)( run( tests( specification, specification + N ), arguments, os ), exit_max_value ); 1376 } 1377 1378 template< std::size_t N > 1379 int run( test const (&specification)[N], std::ostream & os = std::cout ) 1380 { 1381 return run( tests( specification, specification + N ), {}, os ); 1382 } 1383 1384 template< std::size_t N > 1385 int run( test const (&specification)[N], int argc, char * argv[], std::ostream & os = std::cout ) 1386 { 1387 return run( tests( specification, specification + N ), texts( argv + 1, argv + argc ), os ); 1388 } 1389 1390 } // namespace lest 1391 1392 #endif // LEST_LEST_HPP_INCLUDED
